{{POV check|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox scientist |name = Jacob Appelbaum |image = Jacob Appelbaum-IMG 9320.jpg |image_size = 250px |alt = |caption = Jacob Appelbaum at the Congress on Privacy & Surveillance (2013) of the [[École polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne|École polytechnique fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL)]]. |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|4|1}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |residence = Germany |citizenship = [[United States|US]] |nationality = |fields = [[Computer security]] |workplaces = [[University of Washington]],{{cite web |url=https://www.torproject.org/about/corepeople.html |title=Tor Project: Core People |publisher=Tor |accessdate=13 April 2015}}
[[Eindhoven University of Technology]],{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/ioerror/status/638735997396774912 |title=Jacob Appelbaum on Twitter}}
[[Noisebridge]],{{cite web |url=https://www.noisebridge.net/wiki/User:Ioerror |title=Noisebridge user page |publisher=Noisebridge |accessdate=11 October 2011}}
[[WikiLeaks]] |alma_mater = |doctoral_advisor = |academic_advisors = |doctoral_students = |notable_students = |known_for = * [[Computer security]] researcher * spokesperson for [[WikiLeaks]] * spokesperson and developer for [[Tor (anonymity network)|The Tor Project]]{{cite news|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/news/meet-the-american-hacker-behind-wikileaks-20101201|title=The American Wikileaks Hacker|first=Nathaniel|last=Rich|newspaper=[[Rolling Stone]]|date=1 December 2010|accessdate=3 July 2014|quote=An anarchist street kid raised by a heroin- addict father, he dropped out of high school, taught himself the intricacies of code and developed a healthy paranoia along the way.}} * journalist dealing with [[Edward Snowden]] documents |influences = |influenced = |awards = 2014 Henri {{Interlanguage link multi|Nannen Prize|de|3=Nannen_Preis}} |signature = |signature_alt = |footnotes = }} '''Jacob Appelbaum''' (born 1 April 1983) is an [[Americans|American]] independent journalist, [[computer security]] researcher, artist, and [[Hacking (innovation)|hacker]]. He has been employed by the [[University of Washington]], and was a core member of the [[Tor (anonymity network)|Tor project]],{{cite web | url=https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2016/06/tor-developer-jacob-appelbaum-quits-after-sexual-mistreatment-allegations/ | title=Tor developer Jacob Appelbaum quits after "sexual mistreatment" allegations | publisher=Conde Nast | website=[[Ars Technica]] | date=5 June 2016 | accessdate=5 June 2016 | author=Farivar, Cyrus}} a [[free software]] network designed to provide online [[Anonymizer|anonymity]]. Appelbaum is also known for representing [[WikiLeaks]].{{cite news | first=Declan | last=McCullagh | title=Wikileaks editor skips NYC hacker event | url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-1009_3-20010866-83.html | newspaper=[[CNET Networks|CNET News]] |date=17 July 2010 | accessdate=3 August 2010}}
• {{cite news | first=Declan | last=McCullagh | title=Feds look for Wikileaks founder at NYC hacker event | url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-1009_3-20010861-83.html | newspaper=[[CNET Networks|CNET News]] |date=16 July 2010 | accessdate=3 August 2010}}
• {{cite news | first=Ryan | last=Singel | title=Wikileaks Reopens for Leakers | url=https://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2010/07/wikileaks_repair/ | newspaper=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] |date=19 July 2010 | accessdate=3 August 2010}} He has displayed his art in a number of institutions across the world and has collaborated with artists such as [[Laura Poitras]], [[Trevor Paglen]], and [[Ai Weiwei]]. His journalistic work has been published in ''[[Der Spiegel]]'' and elsewhere. Appelbaum has repeatedly been targeted by U.S. law enforcement agencies, who obtained a court order for his [[Twitter]] account data, detained him at the U.S. border after trips abroad, and seized his laptop and several mobile phones. Under the handle "ioerror", Appelbaum was an active member of the [[Cult of the Dead Cow]] hacker collective from 2008 to 2016.{{cite press release|title=CULT OF THE DEAD COW Statement on Jacob Appelbaum / ioerror|date=6 June 2016|publisher=Cult of the Dead Cow|location=|url=http://w3.cultdeadcow.com/cms/2016/06/cult-of-the-dead-cow-statement-on-jacob-appelbaum-ioerror.html|access-date=2016-06-08|last=Veggie|first=Deth|agency=}} He was the co-founder of the [[San Francisco]] [[hackerspace]] [[Noisebridge]] with [[Mitch Altman]]. With several others, he co-founded the [[Seattle Privacy Coalition]], an advocacy group. He worked for [[Kink.com]]{{cite news | first=Lane | last=Hartwell | title=‘So Who Wants to F**k a Robot?’ | url=https://www.wired.com/underwire/2007/10/so-who-wants-to/ | newspaper=[[Wired.com]] |date=10 June 2007 | accessdate=9 August 2013}} and [[Greenpeace]],{{cite news|url=http://weblog.greenpeace.org/intheforest/archives/001473.html |title=Geeks Love Trees, Too |date=22 June 2004 |accessdate=26 January 2011 |last=Appelbaum |first=Jacob |newspaper=[[Greenpeace]] – Weblog |archivedate= 3 August 2004 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040803074600/http://weblog.greenpeace.org/intheforest/archives/001473.html |deadurl=yes |df= }} and volunteered for the [[Ruckus Society]] and the [[Rainforest Action Network]]. The Tor Project and several other organizations ended their association with Appelbaum in June 2016 following several allegations of sexual abuse.{{cite web | url=https://freedom.press/blog/2016/06/statement-jacob-appelbaum | title=Statement on Jacob Appelbaum | publisher=Freedom of the Press Foundation | accessdate=8 June 2016 | author=Trevor, Timm}}{{cite web|title=Noisebridge Statement on Jacob Appelbaum|url=http://blog.noisebridge.net/post/145728465358/noisebridge-statement-on-jacob-appelbaum|website=Noisebridge Blog|accessdate=16 June 2016}}{{cite web | url=https://gizmodo.com/jacob-appelbaum-banned-from-prominent-hacker-conference-1782164249 | title=Jacob Appelbaum Banned From Prominent Hacker Conference Following Sexual Assault Allegations | publisher=Gizmodo | date=2016-06-17 | accessdate=18 June 2016 | author=Turton, William}}{{cite web|url=http://www.itwire.com/business-it-news/open-source/73415-security-expert-appelbaum-no-longer-part-of-debian.html|title=Security expert Appelbaum no longer part of Debian|last=|first=|date=18 June 2016|website=|publisher=ITWire|access-date=|accessdate=2 July 2016}} Appelbaum has denied the allegations.{{cite web | last=Yadron | first=Danny | title=Digital privacy activist Jacob Appelbaum denies colleagues' assault allegations | website=the Guardian | date=6 June 2016 | url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/jun/06/jacob-appelbaum-tor-denies-assault-allegations | accessdate=12 July 2016}} Various activists and others have publicly supported Appelbaum, voicing concerns about [[due process]], trial by [[social media]], and questioning the reliability of the claims.{{cite web|last1=Riegel|first1=Tobias|title=Die Presse und der Pranger|url=https://www.neues-deutschland.de/artikel/1015075.die-presse-und-der-pranger.html|website=neues deutschland|accessdate=17 June 2016|date=13 June 2016|language=German|trans-title=The press and the pillory}}{{cite web|last1=Alphonso|first1=Don|title=Aktivistinnen rufen zum Ende der Hetzjagd gegen Appelbaum auf|url=http://www.faz.net/aktuell/feuilleton/medien/offener-brief-zu-vorwuerfen-ueber-jacob-appelbaum-14284019.html|website=Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung|accessdate=17 June 2016|date=13 June 2016|language=German|trans-title=Women activists call for an end to the witch-hunt against Jacob Appelbaum}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20170608171941/https://ourresponse.org/ After abuse allegations: Activists defend Jacob Appelbaum, Newday Media Agency, 13 June 2016 ] The affair has had repercussions in the on-line privacy advocacy world.{{cite web | url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-switch/wp/2016/07/27/what-you-should-know-about-the-sexual-misconduct-scandal-that-shook-the-privacy-world/#comments | title=Jacob Appelbaum was an online privacy hero. Then a sex misconduct scandal exploded | publisher=The Washington Post | date=2016-07-28 | accessdate=2016-07-30 | author=Peterson, Andrea}} While U.S. news media have treated the allegations as credible,{{cite web | url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/28/technology/tor-project-jacob-appelbaum.html?_r=0 | title=Tor Project Confirms Sexual Misconduct Claims Against Employee | publisher=NYT | date=27 July 2016 | accessdate=27 July 2016 | author=PERLROTH, NICOLE}} reporting in Germany, where Appelbaum lives, has been sharply critical. {{cite news | url=http://www.zeit.de/kultur/2016-08/jacob-appelbaum-rape-sexual-abuse-allegations/komplettansicht | title=Jacob Appelbaum: What Has This Man Done? | first1=Christian | last1=Fuchs | first2=Lars | last2=Weisbrod | first3=Sebastian | last3=Mondial | work=Die Zeit | publisher=zeit.de | id=Number 34 | date=13 August 2016 | accessdate=13 August 2016 | language=English }} No legal action has been taken by either Appelbaum or any accuser. ==Early life and education== Appelbaum says that he tested out of high school and attended junior college briefly before he "stopped college and continued my education."https://web.archive.org/web/20110219135907/http://crypto.nsa.org/f-21/blogger-in-the-lions-den.html In a wide-ranging interview with ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine in 2010, Appelbaum revealed that "I come from a family of lunatics... [a]ctual, raving lunatics." He stated that his mother "is a paranoid schizophrenic. She insisted that Jake had somehow been molested by his father while he was still in the womb". He was taken away from his mother by his aunt when he was 6. Two years later, he was placed in a children's home in Sonoma County. At age 10, his indigent father was awarded custody of him. Having been introduced to computer programming by a friend's father, Appelbaum said, saved his life. "The Internet is the only reason I'm alive today." {{As of|2015|9|1}}, Appelbaum is a Ph.D. student studying under [[Tanja Lange]] and [[Daniel J. Bernstein]] at the [[Eindhoven University of Technology]]. == Career == === Journalism === Appelbaum was among several people to gain access to former NSA contractor [[Edward Snowden]]'s [[top secret]] documents [[global surveillance disclosure|released in 2013]]. He has contributed extensively as a journalist to the publication of those documents. On 23 October 2013, Appelbaum and other writers and editors at ''Der Spiegel'' reported that their investigations had led German Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] to confront the U.S. government over evidence that it was monitoring her personal cell phone. {{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/merkel-calls-obama-over-suspicions-us-tapped-her-mobile-phone-a-929642.html | title=Berlin Complains: Did US Tap Chancellor Merkel's Mobile Phone? | last1=Appelbaum | first1=Jacob | last2=Stark | first2=Holger | last3=Rosenbach | first3=Marcel | last4=Schindler | first4=Jörg | website=spiegel.de | date=23 October 2013 | access-date=30 July 2016 }} US President [[Barack Obama]] issued an ambiguously worded denial and apology. {{cite web | url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/10/23/obama-merkel-national-security-agency/3171477/ | title=Obama says NSA not spying on Merkel's cellphone | last=Jackson | first=David | website=usatoday.com | date=23 October 2013 | access-date=30 July 2016 }} The ''Der Spiegel'' team reported on the resulting controversy and detailed a further claim that the [[Embassy of the United States, Berlin]], was being used as a base of operations for electronic surveillance of its German ally. {{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/cover-story-how-nsa-spied-on-merkel-cell-phone-from-berlin-embassy-a-930205.html | title=Embassy Espionage: The NSA's Secret Spy Hub in Berlin | last1=Appelbaum | first1=Jacob | last2=Blome | first2=Nikolaus | last3=Gude | first3=Hubert | last4=Neukirch | first4=Ralf | last5=Pfister | first5=René | last6=Poitras | first6=Laura | last7=Rosenbach | first7=Marcel | last8=Schindler | first8=Jörg | last9=Schmitz | first9=Gregor | last10=Stark | first10=Holger | website=spiegel.de | date=27 October 2013 | access-date=30 July 2016 }} The BBC commented that "This scandal has caused one of the biggest diplomatic rifts between Germany and the U.S. in recent years." {{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-24690055 | title=US bugged Merkel's phone from 2002 until 2013, report claims | website=bbc.com | date=27 October 2013 | access-date=30 July 2016 }} At the scandal's peak, Merkel compared the [[National Security Agency]] with the East German [[Stasi]] [[secret police]] during an angry conversation with Obama. {{cite web | url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/dec/17/merkel-compares-nsa-stasi-obama | title=Merkel compared NSA to Stasi in heated encounter with Obama | website=theguardian.com | date=20 December 2013 | access-date=30 July 2016 }} [[File:2013-12-29 30C3 - Jacob Appelbaum 3329-crop.JPG|thumb|upright=1.4|Appelbaum at a talk at [[30C3]] in Hamburg (2013).]] The ''Der Spiegel'' team's reporting about Merkel earned the 2014 Henri Nannen prize {{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/kultur/gesellschaft/henri-nannen-preis-spiegel-redakteure-ausgezeichnet-a-969932.html | title=Henri-Nannen-Preis 2014: SPIEGEL-Redakteurin gewinnt mit Gurlitt-Reportage | website=www.spiegel.de | accessdate=29 June 2016 | date=16 May 2014 | language=German }} for investigative journalism. Appelbaum shared the prize with ''Der Spiegel'' writers and editors [[Marcel Rosenbach]], {{Interlanguage link multi|Jörg Schindler|de|3=Jörg Schindler}}, and {{Interlanguage link multi|Holger Stark|de|3=Holger Stark (Journalist)}}. A few days later he provoked a furor by condemning Nannen, the prize's namesake, for his Nazi collaboration, {{cite web | url=http://www.stern.de/panorama/gesellschaft/henri-nannen-im-nationalsozialismus-verseuchte-vergangenheit-3166768.html | title=Henri Nannen im Nationalsozialismus: Verseuchte Vergangenheit | last=Schreiber | first=Hermann | website=stern.de | language=German | date=4 June 2014 | access-date=30 July 2016 }} declaring that he would have his bronze bust of Nannen melted down and recast, and donate his prize money to anti-fascist groups. {{cite web | url=http://www.sueddeutsche.de/kultur/kritik-an-nazi-vergangenheit-preistraeger-appelbaum-will-henri-nannen-preis-einschmelzen-1.197417 | title=Preisträger Appelbaum will Henri-Nannen-Skulptur einschmelzen | website=sueddeutsche.de | language=German | date=24 May 2014 | access-date=30 July 2016 }} {{ cite web | url=http://www.nachtkritik.de/index.php?view=article&id=9572 | title=The social pressure of conformity | last=Appelbaum | first=Jacob | website=nachtkritik.de | date=23 May 2014 | accessdate=3 August 2016 }} On 28 December 2013, at the [[Chaos Communication Congress]],Democracy Now!: [http://www.democracynow.org/2013/12/31/jacob_appelbaum_futuristic_sounding_radar_wave Jacob Appelbaum: Futuristic-Sounding "Radar Wave Devices" Can Help NSA Monitor Your Computer Usage | Democracy Now!]CBS News: [http://www.cbsnews.com/news/nsa-can-spy-on-offline-computers-wirelessly-expert-jacob-applebaum-says/ NSA can spy on offline computers wirelessly, says security expert - CBS News] he presented documents showing that the [[National Security Agency|NSA]] can turn [[iPhone]]s into eavesdropping tools and has developed devices to harvest electronic information from a computer even if the computer is not online. An investigative team at ''Der Spiegel'', including Appelbaum, simultaneously published their findings, {{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/nsa-secret-toolbox-ant-unit-offers-spy-gadgets-for-every-need-a-941006.html | title=NSA Secret Toolbox: ANT Unit Offers Spy Gadgets for Every Need | last1=Appelbaum | first1=Jacob | last2=Horchert | first2=Judith | last3=Reissmann | first3=Ole | last4=Rosenbach | first4=Marcel | last5=Schindler | first5=Jörg | last6=Stöcker | first6=Christian | others=Additional reporting my Andy Müller-Maguhn | website=spiegel.de | date=30 December 2013 | access-date=30 July 2016 }} along with a descriptive list of the surveillance devices making up the [[NSA ANT catalog]]. {{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/a-941262.html | title=Interactive Graphic: The NSA's Spy Catalog | website=spiegel.de | date=30 December 2013 | access-date=30 July 2016 }} On 3 July 2014, German broadcaster [[Norddeutscher Rundfunk|NDR/ARD]] carried disclosures by Appelbaum and others about the operation of NSA's top-secret [[XKeyscore]] surveillance software, including source code proving that a computer of Appelbaum's had been targeted. {{cite news | In August 2013, Appelbaum delivered Edward Snowden's acceptance speech after he was awarded the biannual Whistleblower Prize by a group of NGOs at the [[Berlin-Brandenburg Academy of Sciences and Humanities]].{{cite web|url=http://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/Whistleblower-Preis-fuer-Edward-Snowden-1922132.html |title=Whistleblower-Preis für Edward Snowden |accessdate=25 July 2013 |author=Detlef Borchers |date=23 July 2013 |website=[[Heise online]] |archivedate=25 July 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6IMvcdV8q?url=http://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/Whistleblower-Preis-fuer-Edward-Snowden-1922132.html |deadurl=yes |df= }}Edward Snowden: [http://www.zeit.de/digital/datenschutz/2013-09/edward-snowden-whistleblower-preis-rede/komplettansicht ''Die Wahrheit auszusprechen, hat Whistleblower ihre Freiheit gekostet'' - the acceptance speech in English and German], ''Die Zeit'', 3 September 2013 ===Surveillance, airport detention, and WikiLeaks investigation=== Appelbaum believes he has been under government surveillance since 2009, to the detriment of himself, his friends, and his close relations.[http://www.exberliner.com/features/people/jacob-appelbaum-on-the-usa-and-nsa/ Nadja Vancauwenberghe, "Jacob Appelbaum: Revolutionary times", Exberliner, 22 September 2014] In interviews he has stated that living in Germany has given him a sense of relief from U.S. surveillance.[http://motherboard.vice.com/blog/jacob-appelbaum-utopia-interview John Lubbock, "Jacob Appelbaum's Utopia", Vice News, 6 October 2013] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029195151/http://motherboard.vice.com/blog/jacob-appelbaum-utopia-interview |date=29 October 2013}} Appelbaum has described various aggressive surveillance events, and implies they are related to his work with Wikileaks, to his privacy activism, and to relationships with other privacy activists, notably reporters linked to [[Edward Snowden]]. In December 2013, Appelbaum said he suspected the U.S. government of breaking into his Berlin apartment.{{cite web|title=Snowden ally Appelbaum claims his Berlin apartment was invaded |url=http://www.dw.de/snowden-ally-appelbaum-claims-his-berlin-apartment-was-invaded/a-17315069|website=[[Deutsche Welle]]|accessdate=29 November 2014|date=21 December 2013}} While traveling, Appelbaum has been detained at airports and had his electronic equipment seized several times.Democracy Now!: [http://www.democracynow.org/2012/4/20/we_do_not_live_in_a "We Don’t Live in a Free Country": Jacob Appelbaum on Being Target of Widespread Gov’t Surveillance |Democracy Now!]{{cite news |first=Elinor |last=Mills |title=Researcher detained at U.S. border, questioned about Wikileaks |url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-27080_3-20012253-245.html |publisher=[[CNET Networks|CNET News]] |date=31 July 2010 |accessdate=3 August 2010}}{{cite news |first=Xeni |last=Jardin |title=Wikileaks volunteer detained and searched (again) by US agents |url=http://www.boingboing.net/2011/01/12/wikileaks-volunteer-1.html |newspaper=[[Boing Boing]] |date=12 January 2011 |accessdate=12 January 2011}}{{cite news |first=Paul |last=Fontain |title=Jacob Appelbaum Detained At Keflavík Airport |url=http://grapevine.is/News/ReadArticle/Jacob-Appelbaum-Detained-At-Keflavik-Airport |newspaper=[[Grapevine]] |date=27 October 2011 |accessdate=31 October 2011}} In 2010, the [[US Department of Justice]] obtained a [[Twitter subpoena|court order compelling Twitter]] to provide data associated with the user accounts of Appelbaum, as well as several other individuals associated with WikiLeaks. welcome in our community, either in its physical or online spaces," and on 17 June the [[Chaos Computer Club]] announced that he was not welcome. On 18 June his status as a [[Debian GNU/Linux]] project developer was revoked. On 1 July [[Linux Australia]] barred Appelbaum from future events.{{cite web | url=http://lists.linux.org.au/pipermail/linux-aus/2016-July/022778.html | title=[Linux-aus] Clarifying our position | publisher=linux.org.au | date=1 July 2017 | accessdate=3 July 2016 | author=Blemings, Hugh}} On 10 June, Jill Bähring, a woman whom three witnesses claimed to have seen being abused, flatly denied the abuse allegations.{{cite web |last1=Cameron |first1=Dell |last2=O'Neill |first2=Patrick Howell |title=Woman refutes claims that Jacob Appelbaum sexually harassed her | website=The Daily Dot | date=10 June 2016 | url=http://www.dailydot.com/layer8/jacob-appelbaum-jill-bahring-statement/ | accessdate=12 July 2016}} In a statement released by Gizmodo journalist William Turton, Bähring wrote: "Reading this highly distorted version of my experience, which is being used as one of the 'bulletproof examples' of Jacob's alleged misbehavior, I can’t help but wonder. Wonder about all the stories that have been published the last days. Wonder not only about mob justice on twitter, caused by rumors and speculation, but also about the accounts repeated by those who call themselves journalists. Wonder about how many other stories have been willingly misinterpreted. Wonder about the witnesses in all these stories, who coincidentally always seem to consist of the same set of people. Wonder about their motive to speak on my behalf without my consent."{{cite web | last=Turton | first=William | title=Jill Bahring: I Was Not Assaulted by Jacob Appelbaum | website=Gizmodo | date=9 June 2016 | url=https://gizmodo.com/jill-bahring-i-was-not-assaulted-by-jacob-appelbaum-1781684838 | accessdate=12 July 2016}}[https://www.reddit.com/r/KotakuInAction/comments/4ndcc6/ethics_statement_by_jill_b%C3%A4hring_regarding_jacob/ Reddit entry on Jill Bahring Statement] On 17 June 2016, activists, journalists and legal professionals supporting Appelbaum signed a document defending his right to due process, and deploring the story's treatment by social media. In June 2016, Appelbaum's Berlin apartment was defaced in English and German with [[graffiti]] directly referencing the allegations.{{cite web|last1=Winterbauer|first1=Stefan|title=Jacob Appelbaum und Gina-Lisa Lohfink: Sex als Ware und Waffe im Netz und in den Medien|url=http://meedia.de/2016/06/13/jacob-appelbaum-und-gina-lisa-lohfink-sex-als-ware-und-waffe-im-netz-und-in-den-medien/|website=Meedia|accessdate=17 June 2016|date=13 June 2016|language=German|trans-title=Jacob Appelbaum and Gina-Lisa Lohfink: Sex as a commodity and weapon on the net and in the media}} In July 2016 the Tor Project announced it had completed a seven-week investigation led by a hired investigator. According to Shari Steele, Tor Project "did everything in our power" to treat Mr. Appelbaum fairly, but "we determined that the allegations against him appear to be true." According to her summary of the investigation, which was not released, "many people inside and outside the Tor Project have reported incidents of being humiliated, intimidated, bullied, and frightened" by Jacob Appelbaum, and that "several experienced unwanted sexually aggressive behavior from him." Steele made no mention of rape claims published on the anonymous website. Steele alleged that two other unnamed individuals had also been involved in inappropriate behavior are no longer part of the project. Among other changes, Steele stated that an anti-harassment policy has been drafted.{{cite web | url=https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2016/07/tor-inquiry-many-people-reported-being-humiliated-by-appelbaum/ | title=Tor inquiry: "Many people" reported being "humiliated" by Appelbaum: Going forward, group will now have a new anti-harassment policy, among other changes | publisher=Ars Technica | date=27 July 2016 | accessdate=27 July 2016 | author=Farivar, Cyrus}} On 11 August 2016, the German weekly [[Die Zeit]] published {{cite news | url=http://www.zeit.de/2016/34/jacob-appelbaum-sexueller-missbrauch-vorwuerfe/komplettansicht | title=Jacob Appelbaum: Was hat dieser Mann getan? | first1=Christian | last1=Fuchs | first2=Lars | last2=Weisbrod | first3=Sebastian | last3=Mondial | work=Die Zeit | publisher=zeit.de | id=Number 34 | date=11 August 2016 | accessdate=13 August 2016 | language=German }} a lengthy investigation into the rape charges, including interviews with three people present at the scene of the alleged rape. None of these witnesses corroborated the claims made by the anonymous victim. The article also reports that a second falsely identified victim had demanded that her story be removed from the anonymous website. As of August 2016 the affair was the cause of considerable dissent within the Tor community, with calls for a one-day Tor strike being issued via [[GitHub]] (and later on [[Twitter]] with the [[hashtag]] #TorStrike). Appelbaum has not endorsed this action.{{cite web | url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/josephbernstein/dissent-and-distrust-in-tor-community-following-ja | title=video Tech Dissent And Distrust In Tor Community Following Jacob Appelbaum's Ouster: In the aftermath of the explosive allegations against its most famous advocate, and under new leadership, the Tor Project struggles to move on | publisher=BuzzFeedNews | date=2016-08-23 | accessdate=2016-08-24 | author=Bernstein, Joseph}} ==Personal life== Appelbaum is an [[Atheism|atheist]] of [[Jews|Jewish]] background and identifies himself as [[queer]]. Politically, he is an [[Anarchism|anarchist]].{{cite web|title=Jacob Appelbaum (Part 1/2) Digital Anti-Repression Workshop - April 26, 2012|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=HHoJ9pQ0cn8#at=3323|accessdate=28 June 2013|quote=Like, for me, as an atheist, bisexual, Jew, I'm gonna go on, uh - oh and Emma Goldman is one of my great heroes and I really think that anarchism is a fantastic principle by which to fashion a utopian society even if we can't get there.}} In 2012 he moved to [[Berlin]], where he works under a freelance visa;{{citation needed|date=August 2017}} he has stated that he doesn't want to go back to the U.S. because he doesn't feel safe therehttps://gnunet.org/tor2013tum-video video of a talk at the TU Munich from 24. Juli 2013 (statement at approx. 0:05:00) and in interviews he has provided specific examples of experiences that left him feeling unsafe. Appelbaum also notes strong German privacy protections as reasons for preferring to live in Germany, as opposed to the United States.{{citation needed|date=August 2017}} ==See also== * [[Hacktivism]] {{portalbar|United States|Biography|Computer Security|Mass surveillance|Cryptography|LGBT}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{commons category}} * {{Twitter}} * {{IMDb name|id=3335834}} {{WikiLeaks}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Appelbaum, Jacob}} [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American activists]] [[Category:American anarchists]] [[Category:American atheists]] [[Category:American male bloggers]] [[Category:American bloggers]] [[Category:American computer scientists]] [[Category:Jewish American journalists]] [[Category:Jewish anarchists]] [[Category:Jewish atheists]] [[Category:LGBT Jews]] [[Category:LGBT scientists from the United States]] [[Category:LGBT writers from the United States]] [[Category:Writers about computer security]] [[Category:University of Washington people]] [[Category:WikiLeaks]] [[Category:Cypherpunks]] [[Category:Internet activists]] [[Category:Bisexual men]] [[Category:LGBT scientists]] [[Category:American expatriates in Germany]] [[Category:21st-century American non-fiction writers]]

A '''khanate''' or '''khaganate''' is a political entity ruled by a [[Khan (title)|khan]] or [[Khagan|khagan]]. This political entity is typical for people from the [[Eurasian Steppe]] and it can be equivalent to [[tribe|tribal]] [[chiefdom]], [[principality]], [[monarchy|kingdom]] or [[empire]].
== Mongol khanates (or khaganates) == {{Main|List of Mongol states|List of Mongol rulers}}
After [[Genghis Khan]] established [[appanage]]s for his family in the [[Mongol Empire]] during his rule (1206-1227),<ref>{{harvnb|Peter Jackson|2000|p=[https://books.google.com/books?id=3NZpbDOSAcQC&pg=PA12&lpg=PA12&dq=from+ulus+to+khanate&source=bl&ots=8HAxw1kX_y&sig=CWzj7GsVQI_0B0qEd0I74NgUP6c&hl=mn&sa=X&ei=QxW1UsGyI5DDoATsyoCoCA&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=from%20ulus%20to%20khanate&f=false 12]}}</ref> his sons, daughters,<ref>Jack Weatherford, ''The Secret History of the Mongol Queens: How the Daughters of Genghis Khan Rescued His Empire'', Crown Publishing Group, 2011</ref> and grandsons inherited separate sections of the empire. The Mongol Empire and Mongolian khanates that emerged from those appanages<ref> Thomas T. Allsen, "Sharing Out the Empire: Apportioned Lands under the Mongols", in ''Nomads in the Sedentary World'', ed. Anatoly M. Khuzanov and André Wink (Richmond, Surrey: Curzon Press, 2001): 172–190</ref> are listed below. Furthermore, the [[proto-Mongols]] also established some khanates (or khaganates) such as the [[Rouran Khaganate]].
* [[Khamag Mongol|Khamag Mongol Khanate]] * [[Keraites|Keraite Khanate]] * [[Merkit|Mergid Khanate]] * [[Naimans|Naiman Khanate]] * [[Tatar confederation|Tatar Khanate]] * [[Qara Khitai]] * [[Mongol Empire]] ** {{flagicon image|Golden_Horde_flag_1339.svg}} [[Golden Horde]] ** {{flagicon image|Flag_of_Chagatai_khanate.svg}} [[Chagatai Khanate]] ** {{flagicon image|Il-Khanate_Flag.svg}} [[Ilkhanate]] ** [[Yuan dynasty]] ** [[Timurid Empire|Gurkhans (Timurid Khanate)]] *** [[Mughal Empire|Mughal Empire (Gurkhaniyan)]] * [[Northern Yuan dynasty]] based in Mongolia. * [[Moghulistan]] * [[Kara Del|Kara Del Khanate]]
The [[Oirats]] established the following khanates in the 17th century:
* [[Khoshut Khanate]] * [[Kalmyk Khanate]], established c.1630 by the [[Torghut]] branch of the Mongolian Oirats, settled along the lower [[Volga River]] (in modern Russia and Kazakhstan), 1630-1771 * [[Dzungar Khanate]], formed in 1634, covering [[Xinjiang]] region of China, [[Kyrgyzstan]], eastern [[Kazakhstan]] and western Mongolia; 2 December 1717 - 1720 also styled [[Mongol conquest of Tibet#Resurfacing of the struggle between Dzungar Khanate and Qing dynasty|Protector of Tibet]]; 1755 tributary to the Manchu [[Qing dynasty]], 1756 annexed and dissolved in 1758.

The '''Lang Labor Party''' was a [[political party]] active in [[South Australia]] from 1931 to 1934, aligned with [[Lang Labor]] and the policies of [[Premier of New South Wales]] [[Jack Lang (Australian politician)|Jack Lang]].
==Establishment== It was formed as a result of increasing tensions within the [[Australian Labor Party (South Australian Branch)|Australian Labor Party]] over the party's economic response to the [[Great Depression in Australia]]. The opponents of austerity in the Labor Party, of which Lang was among the most prominent figures, had supported repudiating Australia's debt, while supporters of austerity policies would subsequently introduce the national "[[Premiers' Plan]]" to achieve those ends. The [[Australian Labor Party split of 1931|1931 Labor split]] occurred both at a state and federal level, with Lang's supporters being known as "[[Lang Labor]]".<ref>{{cite web | url=http://primeministers.naa.gov.au/primeministers/scullin/in-office.aspx#section2 | title=In office | publisher=National Archives of Australia | work=Scullin | accessdate=27 March 2015}}</ref>
By May 1931, the "Lang Plan Campaign Committee" had been formed in South Australia to give publicity to and campaign for Lang's ideas. Its members were not, at its inception, outside the Labor Party; however, the breach between Lang's supporters and the mainstream party quickly broadened, and reports that month suggested that a split in the party was imminent.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article45765943 |title=CLEAVAGE IN LABOR PARTY. |newspaper=[[Advertiser and Register]] |location=Adelaide |date=12 May 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=7 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article45765645 |title=Plea for Loyalty to Labor Policy. |newspaper=[[Advertiser and Register]] |location=Adelaide |date=11 May 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=6 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> The committee's president was [[Doug Bardolph]], and its secretary was [[Tom Howard (politician)|Tom Howard]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article128934572 |title=Lang Candidate for Adelaide Seat Unlikely. |newspaper=[[The News (Adelaide)|The News]] |location=Adelaide |date=9 July 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=7 Edition: HOME EDITION |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article35675285 |title=N.S.W. Savings Bank. |newspaper=[[Advertiser and Register]] |location=Adelaide |date=28 July 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=8 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
In July 1931, a [[Adelaide state by-election, 1931|by-election]] was held for the [[South Australian House of Assembly]] seat of [[Electoral district of Adelaide|Adelaide]], in the wake of Labor MP [[Bert Edwards (politician)|Bert Edwards]] being sentenced to jail.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71175516 |title=ADELAIDE BY-ELECTION. |newspaper=[[The Worker (Brisbane)|The Worker]] |location=Brisbane |date=29 July 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=11 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> The Lang Plan Campaign Committee decided to separately contest the by-election, and the secretary of the Ironworkers' Union, [[Martin Collaton]], was chosen as their candidate.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article35671149 |title=LABOR BATTLE FOR ADELAIDE SEAT. |newspaper=[[Advertiser and Register]] |location=Adelaide |date=8 July 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=17 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article35672522 |title=ADELAIDE SEAT. |newspaper=[[Advertiser and Register]] |location=Adelaide |date=14 July 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=8 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> Collaton went on to win the by-election, in which he had been usually referred to as a "Lang Plan supporter" or a "Lang Plan candidate".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71175516 |title=ADELAIDE BY-ELECTION. |newspaper=[[The Worker (Brisbane)|The Worker]] |location=Brisbane |date=29 July 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=11 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
The supporters of Lang had begun being referred to as the "Lang Labor Party" by August 1931, by which time they had established local branches.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article128932288 |title=Lang Supporters Seek Meeting at Thebarton. |newspaper=[[The News (Adelaide)|The News]] |location=Adelaide |date=28 August 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=5 Edition: HOME EDITION |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> In addition to Collaton, the party supported independent Labor state MP [[Bob Dale (politician)|Bob Dale]], who had been expelled from the Labor Party for supporting Lang's ideas, and who would later run for re-election under the party's banner.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article46658358 |title="PREMIERS' PLAN A FAILURE". |newspaper=[[The Barrier Miner]] |location=Broken Hill, NSW |date=11 July 1932 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=1 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article35685696 |title=LANG PARTY AND CONFERENCE. |newspaper=[[Advertiser and Register]] |location=Adelaide |date=21 September 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=7 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref> In October, the Lang Labor Party nominated Bardolph in a [[Members of the South Australian Legislative Council, 1930–1933|Legislative Council by-election]] for the Central District No. 1 seat and ran a significant campaign on his behalf, but saw him defeated by independent [[Joseph Anderson (South Australian politician)|Joseph Anderson]] <ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article110514629 |title=CENTRAL DISTRICT ELECTION. |newspaper=[[The Kadina and Wallaroo Times]] |location=SA |date=7 October 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=2 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article29871006 |title=ADELAIDE: MONDAY, OCTOBER 28, 1931. |newspaper=[[The Advertiser (Adelaide)|The Advertiser]] |location=Adelaide |date=26 October 1931 |accessdate=27 March 2015 |page=6 |publisher=National Library of Australia}}</ref>
==South Australian Lang Labor Party (SALLP)== Two of the three Lang Labor Party MHAs elected at the [[South Australian state election, 1933|1933 state election]], [[Bob Dale (politician)|Bob Dale]] and [[Tom Howard (politician)|Tom Howard]], left the party in 1933 post-election after falling out with leader [[Doug Bardolph]] and formed their own party, the South Australian Lang Labor Party (SALLP).
In June 1934 the four Labor factions were reunited.
==See also== *[[Australian Labor Party (South Australian Branch)]] *[[Members of the South Australian House of Assembly, 1930–1933]] *[[Members of the South Australian Legislative Council, 1930–1933]]

Electoral districts can have different names, see [[list of electoral districts by nation]]. ; Total number of seats : the number of representatives elected to the body in total. ; Election threshold : see [[Election threshold]] ; [[Plurality voting system|FPTP]] : Using the system of First Past The Post voting to pick a single winner per district ; [[Party-list proportional representation|Party list]] : One of many [[Party-list proportional representation]] systems. Where possible, this has been replaced by the allocation system used within the party-list (e.g. [[D'Hondt method]]) ; [[Parallel voting]] : This means that two simultaneous systems are used to elect representatives to the same body. The '''Ministry of Agriculture and Agro-based Industry''' ({{lang-ms|Kementerian Pertanian dan Industri Asas Tani}}), abbreviated '''MOA''', is a [[Ministry (government department)|ministry]] of the [[Government of Malaysia]] that is responsible for [[agriculture]], [[agricultural industry|agro-based industry]], [[agritourism]], [[livestock]], [[animal welfare|veterinary services]], [[fisheries]], [[quarantine]], [[inspection]], [[agricultural research]], [[agricultural development]], [[agricultural marketing]], [[pineapple|pineapple industry]], [[agribusiness]], [[botanical garden]], [[food security]], [[food sovereignty]].
==Organisation== *Minister of Agriculture and Agro-based Industry **Deputy Minister **Second Deputy Minister ***Secretary-General ****Under the Authority of Secretary-General *****Legal Advisor Office *****Corporate Communication Unit *****Internal Audit Unit *****Integrity Unit *****Key Performance Indicator Unit ****Deputy Secretary-General (Development) *****Crops, Livestock and Fishery Industry Division *****Paddy and Rice Industry Division *****Agro-based Industry Division *****Development Division *****Agriculture Drainage and Irrigation Division ****Deputy Secretary-General (Planning) *****Policy and Strategic Planning Division *****National Agriculture Training Council *****International Division *****Marketing and Export Division *****Young Agropreneur Unit and National Blue Ocean Strategy Division ****Senior Under-Secretary (Management) *****Human Resource Management Division *****Finance Division *****Account Division *****Information Management Division *****Administration Division

== Fund for Food (3F) == To increase food production in Malaysia and reduce food imports, [[Bank Negara Malaysia]] and Ministry of Agriculture both provide financing at a reasonable cost, with a minimum of RM10,000 funding.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.thebizjuice.com/all-categories/about-entrepreneurship/agriculture-business-in-malaysia/|title=TheBizJuice {{!}} Government Incentives for Agriculture Business in Malaysia|website=www.thebizjuice.com|access-date=2017-01-10}}</ref>
Only Malaysian-owned institutions (at least 51% ownership) are eligible for the financing. (incorporated under the Companies Act 1965, the Co-operative Societies Act 1993, the Societies Act 1966, citizens residing in Malaysia and entrepreneurs registered under the Companies Commission of Malaysia or any other authoritative bodies)

The '''National Culture Policy''' introduced in 1970 in [[Malaysia]], emphasized an assimilation of the non-Malays into the [[Malay people|Malay]] ethnic group. However, during the 1990s Prime Minister [[Mahathir Mohamad]] rejected this approach, with his ''[[Bangsa Malaysia]]'' policy emphasising a Malaysian instead of Malay identity for the state.
Malaysian National Culture Policy is defined in the "1971 National Culture Policy". <ref>[http://www.johorebar.org.my/content/view/102/27/ 1971 National Culture Policy]</ref> It defines 3 principles as guidelines for 'national culture': # The National Culture must be based on the indigenous [Malay] culture # Suitable elements from the other cultures may be accepted as part of the national culture # Islam is an important component in the moulding of the '''National''' Culture.
The main objectives of this policy was to:
* Restore, preserve and develop culture towards strengthening national culture through joint research, development , education and cultural expansion and connections. * Increase and strengthen cultural leadership through training and guidance to interested individuals. Support and mobilize culture as an effective engine of growth. * Establish effective communication to instill national awareness and Malaysian nationalism. * Fulfill socio-cultural needs. * Improve the standard and quality of arts.

[[File:Dr. Norbert Becker 2015.jpg|thumb|Norbert Becker 2015]] '''Norbert Becker''' (* 1949 in [[Hüffelsheim]], Landkreis [[Bad Kreuznach]]) is a biologist, university lecturer at the [[University of Heidelberg]], scientific-technical director of [[KABS]], and managing director and vice-president of the European Mosquito Control Association (EMCA). He is also president of the [[World Mosquito Control Association]] (WMCA). <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Norbert_Becker|title=Norbert Becker - PhD - Institute for Dipterology|first=Norbert BeckerGerman Mosquito Control Association· Institute for Dipterology 35 91 ·|last=PhD|website=ResearchGate}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.echo-online.de/lokales/nachrichten-rhein-neckar/norbert-becker-geht-beruflich-auf-mueckenjagd_18056260.htm#|title=Norbert Becker geht beruflich auf Mückenjagd|first=Echo Zeitungen|last=GmbH|website=www.echo-online.de}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emca-online.eu/board/|title=EMCA - Board|website=www.emca-online.eu}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wmvca.org/|title=Home|website=www.wmvca.org}}</ref>
== Life and Works == After finishing school Becker studied at Heidelberg University and obtained a Bachelor of Science Degree in biology, physics and chemistry in 1974. He obtained a Master of Science degree in biology in 1976 at the Zoological Institute of the same university in 1976. He then obtained a doctorate in Natural Science there, followed by professorship in biology with Venia Legendi in Zoologie at the Faculty of Bioscience in 1993.
He has been a lecturer at Heidelberg University since 1977, where he became a professor <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soperstrategies.com/about/advisoryboard/norbertbecker/norbertbecker.html|title=Norbert Becker|website=www.soperstrategies.com}}</ref> in 2008, and gives turorials in medical Entomology und Oncology at its Zoological Institute. As a professor, Beccker supervises doctoral students in entomology (e.g. medical entomology) and applied field research in Heidelberg. <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.klinikum.uni-heidelberg.de/ShowSingleNews.176.0.html?&no_cache=1&tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=6966&cHash=c18137dc2b1e6fa013185e2b1ae08c39|title=UniversitätsKlinikum Heidelberg: Bewährte Methode der Schnakenbekämpfung am Rhein soll Malariakontrolle in Afrika unterstützen|website=www.klinikum.uni-heidelberg.de}}</ref>
Becker has been active in mosquito control in the upper Rhine (Schnakenbekämpfung am Oberrhein) since 1976, and since 1981 is the Scientific Director of the German Mosquito Control Organisation and Technical Director of the Community Action Committee for the Fight Against Mosquito Infestation (Kommunalen Aktionsgemeinschaft zur Bekämpfung der Schnakenplage) in Speyer. <ref>{{YouTube|ayAowaJ0a5Y|Norbert Becker in SWR Interview on YouTube}}</ref>
In addition Becker is involved in numerous international organisations and is founding president of the World Mosquito Control Association.
Norbert Becker is married with four grown-up children.
== Activities (selection) == * Member of the Steering Committee (SC) for biology and vector control (BCV) of the (WHO / TDR) in Geneva 1989-1994 * Advisor to WHO / TDR in applied field research, extensive vector-associated consultation as member of the SC for BCV, WHO / TDR in Asia, Africa and South America since 1995 * Director of the Society for Vector Ecology (SOVE European Region) von 1988-1990 * President of the worldwide active organisation SOVE in 1993 * Managing Director and Vide-President of the European Mosquito Control Association (EMCA) since 2000. * Member of the German Expert Committee Mosquitoes as vectors of human diseases since 2015 * President of the World Mosquito Control Assiciation (WMCA) since 2015
Becker‘s goal is to establish a globally active organisation for the control of mosquitos as carriers of disease (Mosquito Control Associations) within the world-wide organisation WMCA in order to limit disease spread by mosquitos in a coordinated manner. By 2018 Becker had published more than two hundred articles
== Honours and Awards == * National Medal of the Slovenian Republic for his successful involvement in mosquito control, presented by the Slovenian Minister of Tourism in Bonn in 1992 * Distinguished Service Award of the Society for Vector Ecology in 1997 * Escherich-Preis of the German Society of Entomology in 2001 * The German Federal Cross of Merit in 2004 * Meritorious Service Award of the American Mosquito Control Association 2010 * Distinguished Life Time Service Award for dedication and outstanding services to the Society for Vector Ecology (SOVE), International Congress of SOVE, Spain 2017
== Literature == * Norbert Becker, Glaser, P., Magin, H.: Biological Mosquito Control on the Upper Rhine , (Commemorative) 20 Years of the Communal Action Organisation against Mosquito Infestation 1996. {{ISBN|3-00-000584-6}} * Norbert Becker et al.ːMosquitoes and Their Control (English), Verlag: Springer, 2nd edition 2010 {{ISBN|978-3-540-92873-7}}

[[File:Erfurter Judeneid.JPG|thumb|Faksimile des Erfurter Judeneids, Alte Synagoge, Erfurt]] The '''Oath ''More Judaico''''' or '''Jewish Oath''' was a special form of [[oath]], rooted in antisemitsm and accompanied by certain ceremonies and often intentionally humiliating, painful or dangerous, that Jews were required to take in [[Europe]]an [[court]]s of [[law]] until the 20th century. ''More Judaico'' is [[Latin]] for "on/by the Jewish custom." The question of the trustworthiness of the Jewish oath was intimately connected with the meaning that [[Christian]] authorities assigned to the ''[[Kol Nidre]]'' prayer, recited by Jews on [[Yom Kippur]], and the whole of the legislation regarding the oath was characteristic of the [[Jews in the Middle Ages|attitude of medieval states toward their Jewish subjects]]. The [[Separation of church and state#History|identification of Church and State]] seemed to render it necessary to have a different formula for those outside the state church.
==Historical development== The [[Disabilities (Jewish)|disability]] imposed on a [[Jew]] engaged in legal contention with a [[Christian]] dates back to [[Byzantine emperor]] [[Justinian I]], who declared that neither Jews nor [[heresy|heretics]] should be admitted as [[witness]]es against Christians; [[Secularism|secular]] courts, however, did not recognize this disability. Thus, in the safe conducts issued by the [[Carolingian]] kings in the 9th century, Jews and Christians were treated as equals, and consequently the [[testimony]] of the former, whether given under [[oath]] or not, was as admissible as the latter. This was distinctly stated in the [[charter]] granted by [[Holy Roman Emperor]] [[Henry IV, Holy Roman Emperor|Henry IV]] to the Jews of [[Speyer]] in 1090. The law of [[Duke]] [[Frederick II of Austria]] (1244), which served as a model for much other [[legislation]] on the Jews, merely required a Jew to [[oath|swear]] "super Rodal" (by the [[Torah]]). Similar laws existed in [[England]], [[Portugal]], and [[Hungary]]; Hungary waived the requirement to swear on the [[Torah]] in trivial cases.
There were, however, some older laws that prescribed certain practices intended to mock Jews in court. These examples illustrated the kinds of humiliating rituals that accompanied the taking of the oath: *[[Byzantine Empire]], 10th century: the Jew would wear a [[Crown of thorns|girdle of thorns]] around his loins, stand in water, and swear by "Barase Baraa" ([[Book of Genesis|Bereshit Bara]]), so that if he spoke untruth, he would be swallowed by the earth just like [[Dathan]] and [[Abiram]] in [[Book_of_Numbers#Chapter_15-17|Numbers 16:1–27]]. *[[Arles]] (c. 1150): a wreath of thorns would be hung on the swearer's neck, others would grovel at his knees, and a thorn branch five [[ell]]s in length would be pulled "between his loins" while he swore and called down upon himself all the [[Curse#Curses in the Bible|curses]] of the Torah. *[[Swabia]] (13th century): the Jew would stand on the hide of a [[Unclean animals|sow]] or a [[Lamb of God|bloody lamb]]. *[[Silesia]] (1422): the Jew would stand on a three-legged stool and have to pay a [[Fine (penalty)|fine]] each time he fell, finally losing his [[legal case|case]] if he fell four times. *[[Dortmund]]: the Jew would be fined each time he halted in repeating the oath. *[[Vrbové]], Hungary (1517): the Jew would stand barefooted and swear with his face turned to the east, holding the [[Pentateuch]] in his hand. *[[Breslau]] (c. 1455): the Jew would stand [[Yarmulke#Purpose|bareheaded]] and pronounce the name of [[Yahweh]].
==An example: Frankfurt oath== [[File:Oathmorejudaico.jpg|right|thumb|300px|A 17th century drawing of a German Jew taking a Jewish oath.]] The following formula, originally in Middle High German, was used in Frankfurt on the Main about 1392:[http://www.fordham.edu/halsall/jewish/1392-jews-frankfort.html] :''The Jew shall stand on a sow's skin and the five books of Master Moses shall lie before him, and his right hand up to the wrist shall lie on the book and he shall repeat after him who administers the oath of the Jews:''
:''Regarding such property of which the man accuses you, you know nothing of it, nor do you have it. You never had it in your possession, you do not have it in any of your chests, you have not buried it in the earth, nor locked it with locks, so help you God who created heaven and earth, valley and hill, woods, trees, and grass, and so help you the law which God himself created and wrote with His own hand and gave Moses on Sinai's mount. And so help you the five books of Moses that you may nevermore enjoy a bite without soiling yourself all over as did the King of Babylon.''
:''And may that sulphur and pitch flow down upon your neck that flowed over Sodom and Gomorrah, and the same pitch that flowed over Babylon flow over you, but two hundred times more, and may the earth envelop and swallow you up as it did Dathan and Abiram. And may your dust never join other dust, and your earth never join other earth in the bosom of Master Abraham if what you say is not true and right.'' [This refers either to a decent burial or to resurrection.] ''And so help you Adonai, you have sworn the truth.''
:''If not, may you become as leprous as Naaman and Gehazi, and may the calamity strike you that the Israelite people escaped as they journeyed forth from Egypt's land. And may a bleeding and a flowing come forth from you and never cease, as your people wished upon themselves when they condemned God, Jesus Christ, among themselves, and tortured Him and said: {{bibleref|Matthew|27:25}} "His blood be upon us and our children." It is true, so help you God who appeared to Moses in a burning bush which yet remained unconsumed. It is true by the oath that you have sworn, by the soul which you bring on the Day of Judgment before the Court, [before the God of] Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. It is true, so help you God and the oath you have sworn. [Amen].''
==The oath as a Jewish disability== A decidedly aggressive change took place when, in 1555, the [[Germany|German]] imperial court procedure (''Reichskammergerichtsordnung'') prescribed a form of oath that, with some alterations, formed a model to subsequent legislation. Horrible were the terms in which the swearer called down upon himself all the curses of [[Leviticus]] and [[Deuteronomy]], the [[ten plagues]] of [[Egypt]], the [[leprosy]] of [[Naaman]] and [[Gehazi]] (see 2 [[Books of Kings|Kings]] 5), the fate of Dathan and Abiram, etc.
According to a recount in his "Gesammelte Schriften," the great German-Jewish philosopher [[Moses Mendelssohn]] of the [[Age of Enlightenment|Enlightenment]] persuaded the [[Prussia]]n government to moderate the terms of the oath during the 18th century. The small German states gradually surrendered the most objectionable features of the oath: [[Electorate of Hesse|Hesse-Kassel]] (or Hesse-Cassel), in 1828; [[Oldenburg]], 1829; [[Württemberg]], 1832; [[Saxony]], 1839 (on which occasion [[Zecharias Frankel]] published his famous "Die Eidesleistung"); [[Schaumburg-Lippe]] and [[Anhalt]]-[[Bernburg]], 1842; and [[Hesse-Homburg]], 1865.
Prussia retained the obnoxious formula until March 15, 1869; the [[Netherlands]] modified the oath in 1818, and [[Russia]] in 1838 and 1860. The Jewish [[advocate]] [[Isaac Adolphe Crémieux]] won great fame by effecting the abolition of the oath through a case brought before the court of [[Nîmes]] in 1827. [[Lazard Isidor]], as [[rabbi]] of [[Pfalzburg]], refused in 1839 to open the [[synagogue]] for such an oath; prosecuted for [[contempt of court]], he was defended by Crémieux and acquitted. The French Supreme Court finally declared the oath [[constitutionality|unconstitutional]] on March 3, 1846. However, as late as 1902, a court in [[Romania]] upheld that country's version of the oath.

'''Operation Socialist''' is the code name given by the British signals and communications agency [[Government Communications Headquarters]] (GCHQ) to an operation in which GCHQ successfully breached the infrastructure of the Belgian telecommunications company [[Belgacom]] between 2010 and 2013.<ref name=operation>{{cite web|last1=Gallagher|first1=Ryan|title=The Inside Story of How British Spies Hacked Belgium's Largest Telcom|url=https://firstlook.org/theintercept/2014/12/13/belgacom-hack-gchq-inside-story/|publisher=The Intercept|accessdate=9 April 2015}}</ref> The operation's existence was first revealed in documents leaked by the former [[National Security Agency]] contractor [[Edward Snowden]]. GCHQ used a method called [[Quantum insert|Quantum Insert]] attack <ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url = http://www.spiegel.de/international/europe/british-spy-agency-gchq-hacked-belgian-telecoms-firm-a-923406.html|title = Britain's GCHQ Hacked Belgian Telecoms Firm|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = Der Spiegel|last = |first = }}</ref> embedded in fake [[LinkedIn]] pages targeting Belgacom engineers<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/ghcq-targets-engineers-with-fake-linkedin-pages-a-932821.html|title = Quantum Spying: GCHQ Used Fake LinkedIn Pages to Target Engineers|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = Der Spiegel|last = |first = }}</ref> The breach was conducted under the code name 'OP Socialist'. The main target of the clandestine infiltration was to gain access to Belgacom's [[GPRS roaming exchange|GRX Operator]] to enable GCHQ to obtain roaming data for mobile devices and execute what is generally referred to as [[Man-in-the-middle attack]] against targets.
When the first anomalies were detected in 2012, Belgacom's security team were unable to identify their cause.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.nrc.nl/nieuws/2014/12/13/verantwoording-en-documenten/|title = Lees hier hoe de Britse geheime dienst GCHQ Belgacom aanviel|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = NRC.NL|last = |first = }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.standaard.be/cnt/dmf20141212_01426880|title = Britse geheime dienst bespioneerde jarenlang Belgacom-klanten|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = De Standaard|last = |first = }}</ref> Only in 2013 [[malware]] disguised as legitimate Microsoft software had been identified as the source of problems.<ref name="operation" />
According to the leaked documents GCHQ probed Belgacom's infrastructure for years.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.infosecurity-magazine.com/news/how-gchq-hacked-belgacom/|title = How GCHQ hacked Belgacom|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = info security|last = |first = }}</ref> According to the leaked documents 'Operation Socialist' has been qualified by the head of the GCHQ's Network Analysis Centre as a success.<ref name=":0" />
Snowden subsequently described Operation Socialist as the "first documented example to show one EU member state mounting a cyber attack on another…"<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.itproportal.com/2014/12/16/gchq-hacked-belgiums-largest-telecom-service/|title = GCHQ hacked Belgium’s largest telecom service|date = |accessdate = |website = IT Pro Portal|publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref>

A '''pad site''' or '''outparcel''' is a freestanding parcel of [[commerce|commercial]] [[real estate]] located in the front of a larger [[shopping center]] or [[strip mall]].<ref name="Plunkett2007">{{cite book|author=Jack W. Plunkett|title=Plunkett's Real Estate and Construction Industry Almanac 2007: Real Estate and Construction Industry Market Research, Statistics, Trends and Leading Companies|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=oDOosCtgVbQC&pg=PT22&dq=%22pad+site%22+real+estate&hl=en&sa=X&ei=pbWAUpDFJIy00wX_qYD4Dg&ved=0CGIQ6AEwCA#v=onepage&q=%22pad%20site%22%20real%20estate&f=false|year=2007|publisher=Plunkett Research, Ltd.|isbn=978-1-59392-413-3|page= }}</ref> Desirable because of their visibility to consumers, accessibility, and the ease of facilitating [[drive-thru]] service, pad sites are typically sought after by [[bank]]s, [[casual dining]], and [[fast food]] restaurants. Pad sites usually range between 2,000 and 75,000 square feet ({{Convert|2000|and|75000|sqft|disp=output only}}). They can be ground leased by developers or purchased outright. The former offers a lower up-front cost, but the user is unable to use the land as [[collateral (finance)|collateral]] to finance building expenses because pad sites do not have their own legal address. The latter requires a larger [[capital investment]], but provides the user an appreciable asset in real estate. == References == <references />
